net.markenwerk.utils.data.fetcher

Class BufferedFetcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.markenwerk.utils.data.fetcher.AbstractFetcher
      • net.markenwerk.utils.data.fetcher.AbstractBufferedFetcher
        • net.markenwerk.utils.data.fetcher.BufferedFetcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Fetcher

    public final class BufferedFetcher
extends AbstractBufferedFetcher
    AbstractBufferedFetcher is a sensible base implementation of Fetcher that uses a byte[] as buffer, while copying all bytes from an InputStream to an OutputStream by sequentially reading from the InputStream into the buffer and then writing from the buffer to the OutputStream.

    The buffer is eagerly allocated in the constructor just once and then used for every operation. A BufferedFetcher is therefore not threadsafe.

    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Torsten Krause (tk at markenwerk dot net)

    • Method Detail

      • obtainBuffer

        protected byte[] obtainBuffer()
        Description copied from class: AbstractBufferedFetcher
        Called by AbstractBufferedFetcher.doCopy(InputStream, OutputStream, FetchProgressListener) to obtain a byte[] to be used as a buffer.

        Every byte[] that is returned by this method will be passed as an argument of AbstractBufferedFetcher.returnBuffer(byte[]) after AbstractBufferedFetcher.doCopy(InputStream, OutputStream, FetchProgressListener) has finished using it.

        Specified by:
        obtainBuffer in class AbstractBufferedFetcher
        Returns:
        The a byte[] to be used as a buffer.
